page.title: 05TRANSPORT WEST LEOMINSTER
page.content: The principal mode of transport is the private automobile. Travel for those without is extremely difficult. Most places in the area are in theory covered by private bus company services, but, in practice, these can be as infrequent as once a week, running at times suitable to the bus companies rather than the travelling public. The timetables are only an approximation of the times when buses may arrive or depart. The drivers know all their passengers and provide a friendly service. Travel out of the area on Sundays and holidays by public transport is impossible and all services cease in the early evening on other days. The nearest railway station is about five miles from the centre of the district. No buses run to the station; there is no taxi rank there.
